nodes.text: A crown was an ornamental headdress worn by a monarch as a symbol of their sovereignty. By extension, the term also designated the state or government headed by a monarch. The crown worn by the kings of Onderon was a gilded headband that resembled a wreath of interlocking leaves. The crown of the kings of Mon Cala was beehive-shaped with a spiked circlet at the base. The Bosses of the Gungans wore a conical crown of rulership with a neck flap.
